node.rich_text: SMB exposes shares to clients, including a set of default, “hidden”($) administrative shares:
: the C drive on the remote machine.
: the Windows installation directory on the remote machine.
: the inter-process communication share,commonly has anonymous access, and exposes named

: printer and fax shares.
SMB pipes: connection similar to tcp connection between client and server, name of the pipe serves as endpoint and hence allows anonymity, hence higher layers can be isolated from lower layers easily achieving abstraction. Gives higher layers access to authorization services of smb for transfer of
The IPC$ share is created by the Windows Server service, and is filled with

for operating system components and applications RPC endpoints exposed via IPC$, including the Server service, Task Scheduler, Local Security Authority (LSA), and Service Control Manager (SCM)
Named pipes on a system can be listed using SysInternal's

tool (windows)
if Server service is running, all named pipes are accessible remotely and are exposed via the IPC$ share, such that they can be written to or read from. They don’t specify what data is sent over them, instead that’s left up to the RPC interface
